website_summaries.verdict: A nice addition to most aquariums, though you may have to replace it eventually after prolonged time in water.
pros: Has wide leaves that provide hiding places for timid fish
Users rave about how attractive it looks in their tanks
cons: A few reports of the color fading and leaves shedding over time
Has some pointed pieces that may be unsafe for some delicate fish like Bettas
Has a "plastic" odor upon arrival – soaking prior to use helps

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Plastic Plant!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 4.9 stars I would. My Betta Loves this plastic plant. Purchased an expensive live plant to replace this and my Betta started stressing out so put this one back in the tank. Reason for 4 stars is because of the pointy parts - had to cut them all off as they could harm fins of fish.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great Artificial Plant
customer_reviews.text: Love this ornament! I bought it for my 20 gallon and it looks amazing. I originally got it to temporarily sit in place while I purchase live plants and wait for my other plants to grow, but this ornament looks very realistic and my betta fell in love with it. So I might keep it. He made it his sleeping spot and sleeps right at the highest leaf. It is very tall and big. It is beautiful though! I've attached photos for visuals. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent color, quality and reflection. CNZ plants are the best value out there.
customer_reviews.text: I used these in my 55 gallon setup for some bulk in my landscape. They are extremely realistic and affordable. The price of aquarium decor is ridiculous, but these are affordable to everyone without looking fake and tacky.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz Hall

customer_reviews.title: Very realistic plant. Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this plant. I bought two of them. each one is a little bit different, just as real plants would be.. looks so real!!! Large, and full. realistic roots. gives nice shady near the base. This goes really well with *Jardin Aquascape Artificial Leaf Water Grass Decorative Aquarium Plastic Plant* which you can see in the picture as well. I got two of this one, and two of that plant and have them lined up in the center of my tank. Looks amazing and NATURAL, and lush.
customer_reviews.author: Will R

customer_reviews.title: Very lifelike
customer_reviews.text: I initially purchased 1 of these to make sure I liked the quality and came back and bought 2 more. Very lifelike and the cost of these are a steal compared to plastic looking ones you get at the pet stores. A friend of mine actually thought the plants were real. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Yen

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!
customer_reviews.text: SO lovely! Full, but not overly large - we have a 5.5 gallon tank and they look perfect in there. They are VERY soft and flexible plastic. Definitely the best I've seen (comparing to pet stores). Obviously far superior to the other two we had, but those came with a heater for free, I wasn't expecting much. I did rinse them thoroughly until they were squeaky clean between my fingers, and so far nothing looking weird in there. Our betta was very curious and went to check them out, he seemed pleased, although ultimately he LOVES his cave, hahah. These are placed below the filter to minimize the movement of the water.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: SHARP POINTS
customer_reviews.text: The plant is large and fills 29 gallon tank well until my live plants grow larger. Be aware: It also has faux thorns hidden on stems. These can be trimmed off and with some work, hot glue and patience it can be made snail and fancy fin safe. I also soaked it for several days because the base smelled strongly of plastic. UPDATE: I threw it away. Many sharp points and not realistic looking.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie1NinerTop Contributor: Aquascaping

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice ok quality
customer_reviews.text: This plant looks very real under the water. There was glue on the base of the plant which was concerning and hit had a somewhat strong chemical order. I’m a little concerned about the chemicals within this plant over time but for the money you can’t complain it looks nice. No color leeching into the water yet either.
customer_reviews.author: MrsN

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this plant. It isn't silk, there is a harder wax on top of it, but it's really soft for a plastic. I'm not concerned about it tearing my bettas fins. It fills up the corner of my 30g pretty well. I only deducted a star, because this thing collects any and all debris/food within a hundred mile radius. Gonna have to clean it frequently. That being said, I'd probably buy a few more of these. It's absolutely beautiful in person.
customer_reviews.author: SterlingME

customer_reviews.title: Perfect plant for a smaller tank!
customer_reviews.text: My African Dwarf Frogs LOVE this plant! I have it in my 10g tank and it fits perfectly and doesn’t look too fake or plastic-y like most others do. The size is perfect for a 10g, doesn’t overwhelm but adds decent coverage to hide chords in the back but also leaves enough space for my top swimmers to swim right over. The leaves are soft enough for my guppies so I don’t have to worry about harming their fancy fins. I did soak and rinse it well but no chemical smell was detected whatsoever. Very happy with this plant!
customer_reviews.author: TerraKim

customer_reviews.title: killed my fish
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT meant for water. The wire inside will rust and kill your fish. Within 6 weeks I lost my entire tank. I couldn’t figure out why everyone else’s dying until I mentioned the plants to my fish guy. I brought in these plants and we discovered that the rusty residue was weeping into the water. I’ll be trying to get my money back. Would probably be cute in a reptile tank though.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: The plant stems are sharp and rust
customer_reviews.text: I liked the plants for my small semi-aquatic turtle that likes to hide in underwater "plants." But each of the three stems has a metal wire core that is not covered at the tip but left exposed. It is sharp and rapidly rusts from exposure to water. Once I discovered this (and was thankful the turtle hadn't injured itself), I dried the plants and coated the exposed wire with silicone rubber. I hope the fix holds up. I would have rated the plants high for durability if it weren't from the wire issue.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Barnett

customer_reviews.title: The most real looking plant!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love the quality of this "aquarium" plant. I use it in my reptile tank for coverage, and it works wonders. Covers so much open empty space and then some (goes past the top but it just curves back down for more horizontal coverage that way. It's the one pictured on the left. It's not rigid or as fake as any other faux plants I got from other sellers. Happiest with this purchase of all terrarium plants, as I returned many..this one definitely is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: EvergreenTree

customer_reviews.title: Recommend by a fish guy on youtube  Excellent
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a lot of china made silk plants are killing our fish..i don't do live plants but use Marina balls..theres a great fish channel who gets there artificial plants from this seller..and no fish kill..some fish will eat and tear up live plants so we need a good artificial...this seller is the Boss..this plant was recommended for the fish guy uses a lot of this style..it does come in 3 sizes..ill get the middle size next time...great artificial plant
customer_reviews.author: Bonita W.Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: strong smell and sharp!
customer_reviews.text: please don't use this product if your fish have sensitive fins, this is definitely not ok betas, was going to put it into a 20 gallon tank after opening it the smell was terrible no matter how many times I washed it off! its a little big for my tank, and probably wont be using this. due to the sharp edges. and strong smell would suggest you buy something a little more expensive as there are many plants in this price range that are made much better
customer_reviews.author: DanielleTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality!
customer_reviews.text: Cute plants, nice material, perfect size! I put 2 of these in a tank for my bearded dragon as decoration and to add some variation, and color so he doesn’t get bored. He honestly seems a lot happier with them in it. He also hasn’t tried to eat it either, he just sits under the leaves where it provides shade.
customer_reviews.author: Sammi

customer_reviews.title: Not fish safe, floats, dont buy
customer_reviews.text: Smells awful Doesnt have ANY suction cups or ANYTHING to hold it down Floats When I put it in the tank after rinsing and disinfecting.....3 fish died. I IMMEDIATELY took it out and it still smelled like burnt rubber. Let it air for over a month and it still stinks. I threw it out....couldnt even get it to stay down with a rock on top of it anyway
customer_reviews.author: patriot2061

customer_reviews.title: The leaves are nice, but repurposed because of sharp exposed wires
customer_reviews.text: Didn't put it in the tank as-is because of the exposed wires, but it made for a nice little betta hide when I fixed the stems onto suction cups near the surface. The leaves have a soft vinylish feel to them. Stems are stiff enough to hold shape out of the water, not sure why the wires were necessary. Soak and rinse well or leave out a few days to help dissipate the plastic smell.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Plant
customer_reviews.text: One of the best plastic aquarium plants I've purchased. The life like features of the leaves and the vibrant green colors add a very nice and natural touch to your aquarium. The leaves are held on a metal stem covered in plastic, connected to a solid rock base. The leaves also provide a lot of cover for your fish to swim under. It makes shy fish like gouramis feel more secure in their environment. Other fish like plecos and snails benefit from the large surface areas of the leaves as they graze on the leftover food and algae that grow on it. Tremendous amount of functionality along with beauty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Realistic, soft plant - great for sensitive bettas!
customer_reviews.text: I am really glad I got this plant! I have a crowntail betta so I am VERY careful about what decor I put in his tank as I don't want anything that could harm his fins. This plant is perfect. I have a 5.5 gallon tank and this is just perfect to make one corner a nice hiding spot. It's very natural looking and gentle to the fish. I'm super happy with this plant.
customer_reviews.author: Kitchen Witch

customer_reviews.title: Good design, lifelike, heavy weighted
customer_reviews.text: These plants are so cool. They are durable and look great in the aquarium. I have two that I use together to create a full plant but only one looks spectacular as well. I especially wanted a large wide plant to cover the broken sail on my sunken ship and this plant does the job. the leaves are wide and the plant itself is wide. The plastic is safe for the fish and the bottom is nicely weighted. You can sit it on top of your gravel, or sand, or slightly bury the base without any worry about it floating to the top. You will be happy with this Lifelike artificial plant.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkles

customer_reviews.title: Very realistic!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 3 gallon 360 view tank for african dwarf frogs fills the entire tank. Bigger than I expected but great for my frogs to lounge and hide in. Very natural looking and super easy to clean. Only down side is that the plant is very large so the weight bottom when covered with sand won't hold it down had to place some large river rocks around the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Forward

customer_reviews.title: I Found No Wires
customer_reviews.text: or metal, spikes, etc...that other customers mentioned and I inspected it carefully. Ok, the leaves have pointy ends but they aren't sharp as to tear a fish's fins. (unless the fish intentionally rubs itself back and forth using the leaves or stems like a scratching post, something I have never witnessed) I like this plant because there is a lot of space between the leaves and stems to allow the fish to swim in and out.
customer_reviews.author: James H.

customer_reviews.title: Did not last a month with a corn snake
customer_reviews.text: Although I was happy with the plant when I first installed it in our corn snake’s terrarium, she’s smashed it flat in less than a month. I’ve tried to re-fluff it but it collapses right away. We also bought an Exo Terra star cactus around the same time which the snake rubs against when shedding and it’s in perfect condition as are the older Exo Terra plants in her enclosure. This one just didn’t hold up.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but be careful for betta fin tears
customer_reviews.text: It’s nice. Much bigger than I thought for my 5 gallon tank. My betta loved it because he could hide in it and lay on it, but I did have to cut some of the sharp pieces to avoid him ripping his fins. Also it’s a little tricky to clean. Other than that it looks beautiful underwater.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Looks real! Great for fish to hide
customer_reviews.text: My fish did not die from it! It looks real and the color hasn't faded yet which is good. I've had it for a few months now and it is still in great condition. It is really easy to clean (I just hose it down). It is also soft so the fish can swim through it and hide in it.
customer_reviews.author: Honest opinions

customer_reviews.title: Fish love it
customer_reviews.text: My clown fish love this plant. They sleep in it and spend a lot of time going through the leaves. It did loose some of it's leaves but that could be because the current is too heavy for it. You need to firmly secure it to the bottom. For us this meant putting a lot of subsurface over the brown part. Once we did that it never moved again.
customer_reviews.author: A Reasonable Person

customer_reviews.title: Great for Chameleons
customer_reviews.text: I bought this plant to drip water down for my baby chameleon to drink. It works perfectly because it is pretty tall, so she doesn't have to climb all to the way to the bottom of her terrarium, and it has a nice waxy coating that allows the water to drip down it just as it would on a natural leaf.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Toxic , don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty sure that this plant is toxic and has killed two of my guppies and is killing my molly!! I’ve been using fake plants from the verified pet stores for months now and not once did my fishes show signs of bad health. All of a sudden, I buy this fake plant from amazon and it releases so much plastic into my water! It’s killing my freaking fish! I’m currently medicating my tank but it’s so sad to see my once big, pretty and active molly just on the brink of death now
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Good for small and large tanks
customer_reviews.text: I have these in two tanks. I got a hunch back in 2017 and placed them in my 75 gallon tank. They held up really nice, still have the same color and look natural 2 years later. I just got one for my small 2 gallon tank and one in there works great as well. So it’s perfect for small and large tanks.
customer_reviews.author: nat

customer_reviews.title: Great aquarium plants
customer_reviews.text: This cute little plant is a lovely addition to my aquarium. My fish love to hide in the artificial plants, and the plants make the aquarium look so much cooler. It really brings a super nice touch to the aquarium. I would totally buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: HotDigittyDog

customer_reviews.title: Sharp metal sticking out in several places
customer_reviews.text: Not safe for fish, especially not for betta. My betta swims through the leaves and tore his fins. When I more closely examined the fake plant, I realized there are numerous metal edges sticking out and other sharp places that have not place in a fish tank.
customer_reviews.author: NorthEasternBelle

customer_reviews.title: May be unsafe
customer_reviews.text: I had to update my review. After a few days I noticed the glue job was done poorly. I had to pull out 4 fish and remove the glue that was on the plants from their bodies. Be aware if you buy the plants, take time to remove all the loose glue.
customer_reviews.author: Kin San Nicolas

customer_reviews.title: Great for terrariums & bug/reptile tanks
customer_reviews.text: I have this in an Invertebrate/Bug tank. I loved the look of the first one so much that I bought 4 more for all my other tanks. It is fairly real looking, and the critters love climbing up into it and hiding/sleeping under the leaves. They have held up well (I got the first one about a year ago) to the heaver ones hanging on the leaves and me picking it up daily to check in and under it for everyone. If I get more tanks I will for sure buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany I. Bellows

customer_reviews.title: So realistic
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely happy and so are my fish, despite their looks of disapproval. I would highly recommend to anyone who wants a realistic look. It is huge! Perfect for my 55gal tank. My fish started playing hide n seek right away. Thanks for such a well made aquarium plant at a great price. I will be purchasing more, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Tabi Rexford

customer_reviews.title: Really natural look in tank! Nice length, free flowing.
customer_reviews.text: Very lifelike in water. No chemical smell but still advised to rinse and soak prior to use in aquarium. Really soft material compared to a lot of other artificial aquarium plants I have had in past. Larger radius than expected. May be too big for tank under 20 gallons but that's just a personal preference. My shrimp will love it.
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey but worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: The realistic appearance is really impressive. I have a tank of silver dollars which makes it impossible to have live plants, these plants are the perfect solution. I don't believe the leaves are sharp enough to hurt the fish and the colors look great. Do keep in mind that this plant is pretty big. Overall, I'm really happy with my purchase. I will probably update in a few months if I notice the color fading like some of the other reviews have stated.
customer_reviews.author: Tenley Swann

customer_reviews.title: Plants
customer_reviews.text: These look pretty cool in the tank. Variety looks nice in scaping an aquarium. I like them. The Algae eater likes them. Broad leaves. Are they soft? Not really. They seem sturdy. The base is a love/hate kinda thing. It’s big and hard to bury. It’s big and stays put.
customer_reviews.author: Ricszy

customer_reviews.title: A very full plants for the price you pay
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought this, I was expecting a cheap, little, plastic-looking aquarium plant like you'd get from Walmart. Heck, Walmart's are like $12, so I bought this one instead. This plant is WAY bigger than I thought it was going to be! It is very full, and the color is just beautiful. It looks awesome in my brother's swamp-themed freshwater tank. It was definitely worth the price, and pulling it out of the box, I was so stunned at what I got. I'll probably be ordering another one for my own tank.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Potentially toxic to fish
customer_reviews.text: The plant had loose plastic pieces and when I tried to rinse it before placing it into the tank, the black color on the bottom started to come off. It is reasonable to assume that the paint is not exactly friendly to living organisms, so I returned the product. I bought another plastic plant from CNZ in February (it has a seperate listing and the bottom is slightly different), and it didn't lose any color and there were no pieces of plastic coming off. It appears that this seller sells products manufactured in different factories.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is very large but not very high quality. It has metal wiring in it and in some places the wire was exposed. I didnt like the idea of putting something that would rust in my tank. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: JMcK

customer_reviews.title: A great hiding spot
customer_reviews.text: I like how this plant was very different from any of the others that I have in my 55 gallon tank. My fish absolutely love being able to “hide” under the big leaf. My shark basically claimed it the second it got put in the tank but my other fish try and use it as well. We will definitely be buying more to keep them all happy. And me too!!! I love seeing my fish enjoy the things I put in there for them.
customer_reviews.author: mercy

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a living plant!
customer_reviews.text: This plant looks as good as it gets to a living plant!!! 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: ASTON MARTIN Expert

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking plant.
customer_reviews.text: This is well made and looks great. If you have anything other than fish, you will need to use a suction cup with a hook to hold it in place. My fire-bellies use it as a jungle gym/hide and it will easily tip over if not secured.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: They look great. My Yo Yo Loach and Bristlenose Pleco sleep ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these and am getting more. They look great . My Yo Yo Loach and Bristlenose Pleco sleep together on the same leaf everyday. I am going to buy more so I'll have extra. Great deal for a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Smith Newberg Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Elegant and soft!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my betta. Bettas have delicate flowing tails and it’s important to remember hard plastics could shred their lovely tails! These plants are super silky soft, my betta loves swimming thru the leaves, she even camps out under the larger leaves. She’s constantly exploring this plant, and it looks natural even tho it’s fake. A+ product.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Viguerias

customer_reviews.title: Glue seeping into water
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our new African Dwarf Frogs' tank and the glue was seeping out of it the day after I put it into the tank. If my frogs would've eaten it before I noticed, I'm sure they'd be dead. Yet another disappointing product that I bet was made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna G.

customer_reviews.title: Looks incredibly real!
customer_reviews.text: The most realistic artificial plant available in my opinion. I only wish they made more like it in other species. Very happy! I now know why then can’t keep them in stock. Very very happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Persnickety Client

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart right out if the box
customer_reviews.text: Two large leafs were already off when I pulled it out of the plastic wrap, one more fell off when placing it in the tank. Still "o.k." looking, but not what I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More plants like this! I want more plants this great!
customer_reviews.text: If it were possible I would give this plant at least 10 stars! Over the years I have purchased many, many artificial plants, but now they look so dismal compared with this one! Pictures just can't show how realistic and beautiful this plant is. If the supplier has more plants that are this natural looking, I would buy them all! Best $8.99 I've ever spent! Thanks CNZ!
customer_reviews.author: JamieJ

customer_reviews.title: Crested gecko loves this. Durable.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use in my crested gecko tank. Looks great. It's his favorite plant to sit on. Large leaves. Good hiding places. Weighted base to keep it from tipping. Holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: Mamamia

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I love how they turned out in my tank! My little betta loves them. They provide enough space for him to swim in and around them! He had so much fun exploring his new plants.
customer_reviews.author: Simple Geek

customer_reviews.title: This plant looks great, and I even ordered a different size for ...
customer_reviews.text: This plant looks great, and I even ordered a different size for my other aquarium. Unfortunately, my fish got sick & died about 4-5 days after I put it in my aquarium. I removed them both & rinsed/soaked them to remove any contamanents, but haven't tried putting them back in yet since I'm worried they may kill my new fish.
customer_reviews.author: Karen D.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: A bit bigger than I thought it would be for my 10 Gal hermit crab tank so I just snipped of the top 2 leaves to fit in my tank. Great quality and great weight to stop it from falling over.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Coombs

customer_reviews.title: the plant does look really nice and realistic
customer_reviews.text: the plant does look really nice and realistic. However, parts of it came apart when I put it in the water. I was able to reinsert. you would think they would glue all the parts together so they wont come apart so easily. I have African cichlids and these guys like to yank and pull on things just to see and having to put part of the plant back every other day is a pain. I have to purchase silicone to glue the parts together so this wouldn't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Than Ho

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, but not quite as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't look like the picture. I was expecting something a little smaller, but these are quite huge! Kinda, sorta looks like this, but it is still a nice looking plant for my 29G aquarium. Was going to place them near the front and close-in foliage, but now going in the back. Will keep them though.
customer_reviews.author: Landru

customer_reviews.title: Good value, nice look Fits well in 10g tank.
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Looks very natural. Bury the "root" part so it's barely showing for best look. Only down side is that the leaves did stain from uneaten food but it ended up looking even nore natural after I cleaned them up. A little brown to mix with the greens. It's in the back left of the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: On the larger side
customer_reviews.text: This is a rather large plant. My Corydoras catfish love sleeping under the leaves, and even on the leaves too on occasion. When the plant arrives, spread out the leaves to your liking and rinse under tap water before placing in the tank.
customer_reviews.author: S. Densmore

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This looks great in the tank, the fish love hiding under the leaves, and the leaves are large enough that cleaning them is easy. We have a 40 gallon tank and this sits in one corner. I have owned it since January and even with regular washing, none of the leaves have fallen off or look worn out like other brands I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Cute little plant
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little plant. The base is weighted nicely. If I could ask anything, it would be for it to be fuller, but it sitll looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Long-time Mom

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This fake plant is very full and from a distance looks pretty real. I am ordering one more for my tank. Good for my parrot cichlids to hid behind.
customer_reviews.author: Corinna

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful for a fake
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful fake plant. Realistic looking and nice shade of green. The roots are a little off being red but you just cover with gravel or cut them off. I use fake plants in my quarantine only and this one provides nice comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Ludybelle

customer_reviews.title: Flows well in water
customer_reviews.text: Very nice artificial plant for the money. Placed a short distance from the water filter and flows real nice with the water during lighted and dim times. Looks awesome.
customer_reviews.author: mrcmeurer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t very durable.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the way it looked in my 65gal tank.but after 2 months started to fade in color and some of the leaves have almost turned white very disappointed. Noticed starting to fall apart too. Wouldn’t advise to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Warning
customer_reviews.text: Warning do not buy for your fish tank brought 2 and out it in my 300gal tank woke up the next day 2 fish was dead toxi black stuff coming off it
customer_reviews.author: kc8937

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: in the betta tank. Lots of leaves for fish to nap on. Big enough to be the only large plant needed in a 2 1/2 gallon. I don't really care for the red roots at the bottom and plan to cut those off next time I do a deep tank clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Fish love this!
customer_reviews.text: I tried to plant live plants and they all died and rotted, so luckily I had bought this as a backup at the same time. Now that it is in the aquarium, it looks amazing! And my fish absolutely love swimming around in this plant.
customer_reviews.author: Sherie W

customer_reviews.title: Lost leaves
customer_reviews.text: My African cichlids love this plant in their 55 gallon tank. I agree with other reviews that despite being plastic, the leaves are soft, and it looks real enough. However, on first sponge cleaning the very top leaf set and shoots stripped off the stem and cannot be reattached. I tried sliding them back on but they just float off again. I still use it but with 2 large leaves gone it lost fullness and about 2" of height.
customer_reviews.author: EndlessSummer

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR BETTA
customer_reviews.text: It came with a weird residue on it but I washed it thoroughly before putting it in my 5 gallon betta tank, fits perfect in the very center... I fanned out the leaves more by over needing them, which did no harm to the structure of the plant, soft enough for fish (betta) fins and my betta loves to nap on the leaves that face upward
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Howes

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this plant for my betta! It ended up being the perfect size for 3 1/2 gallon tank. The leaves will be great for him to lay on. I'm not crazy about it being plastic, so we will see!
customer_reviews.author: Holley C.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last long. Arrived with several areas of visible ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t last long. Arrived with several areas of visible glue that started falling off when submerged in water. Had to remove it from tank.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: looks grate in a 40 gallon tank
customer_reviews.text: looks great in a 40 gallon tank and the wide leaves provide a good cover for fish. i am not sure about the longevity but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: customer in VA

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Nice plant for 3.5 gallon bow tank. All fish love it and it looks nice. Hope it holds up over time b/c I love the look of it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lou

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Very realistic and large. I took off one star because fish are able to pluck off tips. A good value.
customer_reviews.author: CBGB

customer_reviews.title: My Cories love the Shade!
customer_reviews.text: This plant grows Algae very quickly. My snails take care of that. Bottom and Mid dwelling fish love it. Would recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Thompson

customer_reviews.title: LOOKS REAL - NICE AND FULL
customer_reviews.text: The price for the product is a bargain when compared to what one pays at PETSMART - their selections are quite pricey.
customer_reviews.author: NightandDay

customer_reviews.title: My favorite aquarium plant!
customer_reviews.text: Really a great fake plant. I was using silks and just had to dispose of 2 of them when they became ragged. When I opened this plant, I was really impressed with both the look and the feel. It actually looks like a real plant. It is sturdy, but not so stiff that it can't sway in the water. The leaves are a nice flexible almost rubbery plastic, which adds to the realistic appearance. The colors are perfect. Looks great in my 27 gallon ciclid tank. I really wish I could find out who manufactured it, so I could buy more plants made with this material.
customer_reviews.author: J. Veenstra-Walters

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product bearded dragon approved no spikes or sharp edges to hurt our little friend wonderful buy
customer_reviews.author: Motherducker

customer_reviews.title: Could be cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Would be perfect for reptiles. Nice foliage for my red eyed croc skink. Tall, wide and appealing. Its not as sharp as these guys are saying it is. Only cons I see so far is it’s kinda pricey for plastic plant. Cheaper to buy a real one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Large
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a large tank and it would have done great in there. I actually use it as decor for my leopard gecko now.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Ivey

customer_reviews.title: A little bigger than 6 inches
customer_reviews.text: Great plant and very nice looking, but its huge! I got this for my betta tank knowing it was going to be a little big but this plant is over 6 inches like I ordered. I can also use it for my turtles tank so not a big deal but love how it looks. My betta loves to lay on the leaves and weave in and out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Ansaldo

customer_reviews.title: Algae
customer_reviews.text: Started to frazzle on the ends and grew red algae. took it out of the tank. No matter how many water changes i did or how many times i emptied that giant tank to clean it, it just harbored and grew algae..if only some one made plants that were not made of soft material or plastic..
customer_reviews.author: ChameleonHair

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful decoration for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this faux plant. It's large, but not too large for my 10 gallon tank. My goldfish love to dart around and hide in the plant's large soft leaves. It anchors solidly and holds its shape. I only recommend shaping the plant once you remove its packaging. It arrives kind of flattened.
customer_reviews.author: Maria W.

customer_reviews.title: Very realistic looking
customer_reviews.text: Very realistic. The plant is really nice and big. I would definitely buy again or recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: changing the sight lines of the angel fish
customer_reviews.text: I have one angel fish that I have noticed is nipping at the other smaller ones. So, I have set up a good change in the sight line. If he can't see them, he won't bother them. And it is nice looking too.
customer_reviews.author: CoCo's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to a tank
customer_reviews.text: it looks realistic and its not hard and doesn't feel pointy. I've had mine for a year and it still looks great
customer_reviews.author: paula sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Love the size, good for 10gallon tank
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a 10gallon tank and for a Betta plus tank mates. He loves it and so did the tetras. Price is worth the product. Definitely will buy again, whenever I need new plants. Perfect to place in corner of tank for hiding spots. Easy to adjust if needed to spread the plants and stems out more.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Very realistic
customer_reviews.text: Love these plants!! Everyone thinks they are real and want to know what kind of plants they are. When I tell them they are plastic no one can believe it. I ordered 2 and will be getting more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa B

customer_reviews.title: Nature at it's best
customer_reviews.text: Stands on it's own with out me adding additional rocks. Looks like it came from Nature.
customer_reviews.author: horses386

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I love how so realistic the leaves look and the jungle feeling it gives my 10gl tank. also my Betta fish loves to hide in the leaves and even sleep on them
customer_reviews.author: Breeanna

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and Realistic!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful and realistic. Held up for a month so far with no discoloration. Am a fan!
customer_reviews.author: S. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: I buried the entire bottom so it looks like only the stalks of the plant are coming out ...
customer_reviews.text: The picture seems darker than it actually is. I buried the entire bottom so it looks like only the stalks of the plant are coming out and it looks great. The only thing that is making me not give it 5/5 stars is that it looks relatively fake even from where I view the tank from, though that is not horrible. I have them in the back corners of my tank, so the “fakeness” isn’t too noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Buford

customer_reviews.title: 10" is underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: The smaller version is limp and wilting. It could stand to have stronger stems to look more upright and lifelike. The larger version is much nicer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Warning, this item is not small, so if ...
customer_reviews.text: Warning, this item is not small, so if you have a 5 to 10 gallon tank, it mght not be suitable for your tank. Luckily I have two tanks, one is 14 gallon and one is 114 gallon tank. of course, it will go to my 114 gallon tank. :)
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Navasca

customer_reviews.title: Great aquarium decor
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Looks realistic. Soft and provides great cover for my betta. Wonderful value. Easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Zen 101

customer_reviews.title: Very attractive
customer_reviews.text: Great plant! Very full and lifelike. I like the heavy base that keeps the plant from moving around.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Looks real
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking (fake) plant. Everyone is like what kind of plant is it and I say fake. And I seem to get a quizical look and I say it's silk, it's not a real plant.
customer_reviews.author: Eurotrash

customer_reviews.title: Impressed for the price
customer_reviews.text: The branches and leaves are not positionable. But overall it's a good quality piece. Not sharp at all. Actually pretty soft and lightweight leaves. Weighted bottom. Was slightly bigger than I thought it would be which is nice Inspect for glue and wash before using. Found some hot glue looking pieces that needed to be removed.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Coon

customer_reviews.title: Betta fish uses this
customer_reviews.text: Betta fish love it! Fish hide and swim through the branches. It fills the corner of a 3 gallon tank. My betta fish doesn't need any extra decorations and seems happily active.
customer_reviews.author: Nana Wife

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing in person. Because if the awkward cylindrical shape of my tank, my fish was afraid of it since it was set directly on the bottom, beneath the fish.
customer_reviews.author: Liz E.

product_meta.title: CNZ Aquarium Fish Tank Green Lifelike Underwater Plastic Plant Aquatic Water Grass Decor
product_meta.description: Size:35 x 26.5cm13" high, ceramic base, green plastic leaves, easy to clean, etc. Provides an excellent hiding place for fish. Anchored with a weighted base, so it will stay where it has been placed in the tank. Provides a beautiful decoration in your aquarium. A wonderful gift choice.
feature_bullets: Product Name: CNZ Lifelike Aquarium Plastic Plant
Material: Plastic, Ceramic; Main Color: Green; Net Weight: 135g
Package Content: 1 x Aquarium Plastic Plant
